means: 包( wrap的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Harry had carefully bought and wrapped presents for Mark to give them.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈里精心购置了礼物又仔细包好，让马克交给他们。

sentence.Network_en: She was sitting in an armchair with blankets wrapped round her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坐在扶手椅中，身上裹着毯子。

sentence.Network_en: She came out with two packages wrapped in holly-sprigged paper.
sentence.Network_cn: 她抱着两个用带有冬青枝叶图案的纸包装的盒子走了出来。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《Friends》词汇表A ... restless adj. 得不到休息的, 不平静的, 不安宁的 wrapped adj. 有包装的,预先包装的 startle v. 震惊.
not yet wrapped or having the wrapping removed .没有包装的或去掉包装的。
The vegetables wrapped in preservative film are refined vegetables ., 这些用保鲜膜包着的菜是精菜.

the active temperament of an Aries is most suited to chocolate beans or soft fruit sweets wrapped in a coloured sugar coating , both of these energetic are a perfect match for them .白羊座好动的性子最适合有彩色糖衣包裹的巧克力豆或果汁软糖，这两样全都充满了生命力，与他们绝对是相得益彰。

PS快捷键_百度百科 ... Palette Knife－（ 调色刀） Plastic Wrap－（ 塑料包装（plastic wrap）） Poster Edges－（ 海报边缘）.
进出口专业英语词汇(W2) ... wrapping counter 包装记数器 wrapping machine 包装机 wrapping paper and cardboard 包装纸及纸板.
work up 激发（情感）wrap up 席卷而去； 包起来think up 想出

entry.def: When you wrap something, you fold paper or cloth tightly round it to cover it completely, for example in order to protect it or so that you can give it to someone as a present.

example.ex: Harry had carefully bought and wrapped presents for Mark to give them...
example.tran: 哈里精心购置了礼物又仔细包好，让马克交给他们。

example.ex: Mexican Indians used to wrap tough meat in leaves from the papaya tree.
example.tran: 墨西哥印第安人过去常用番木瓜树叶把难嚼的肉包起来。

entry.def: Wrap is the material that something is wrapped in.

example.ex: I tucked some plastic wrap around the sandwiches to keep them from getting stale.
example.tran: 我用塑料包装纸把三明治裹起来，防止变质。

entry.def: When you wrap something such as a piece of paper or cloth round another thing, you put it around it.

example.ex: She wrapped a handkerchief around her bleeding palm...
example.tran: 她用手绢将流血的手掌包扎起来。

example.ex: Then she stood up, wrapping her coat around her angrily...
example.tran: 然后她站了起来，怒气冲冲地穿上大衣。

entry.tran: 用(手臂、指头或腿)围紧;用…绕住
entry.def: If someone wraps their arms, fingers, or legs around something, they put them firmly around it.

example.ex: He wrapped his arms around her.

entry.def: A wrap is a piece of clothing which women wear round their shoulders, either to keep them warm when wearing an evening dress, or for decoration over a coat.

entry.tran: 保密，秘而不宣（常指待日后宣布）
entry.def: If you keep something under wraps, you keep it secret, often until you are ready to announce it at some time in the future.

example.ex: The bids were submitted in May and were meant to have been kept under wraps until October...
example.tran: 标书5月份递交，本欲10月份才予以公布。

example.ex: The date and venue of the game must remain under wraps...
example.tran: 比赛的时间和地点必须保密。

means.word_mean: 1. covered with or as if with clothes or a wrap or cloak;

sentences.sentence: "so intent on this fantastic...narrative that she hardly stirred"- Walter de la Mare

means.word_mean: 3. enclosed securely in a covering of paper or the like;

list.explanation: (军队用语)被复杂、琐碎、无谓的事纠缠得脱不了身的

example.en: He was involved in their messy troubles and got wrapped around the axle.
example.zh: 他被卷进了他们那些乱七八糟的纠纷里，弄得脱不了身。

auth_sentence.content: The address wrapped up the Democrats' political convention.
auth_sentence.res_content: The address wrapped up the Democrats' political convention.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The address wrapped up the Democrats' political convention.

auth_sentence.content: We were wrapped in scarves but were still shivering.
auth_sentence.res_content: We were wrapped in scarves but were still shivering.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We were wrapped in scarves but were still shivering.
